com.flir.flironesdk

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a raw frame received from the camera that can be rendered into a colorized, MSX, or visible-only image with a FrameProcessor instance.
    See Also:
    FrameProcessor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void save(java.lang.String path, RenderedImage.Palette previewPalette)

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static Frame load(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a saved frame from an input stream. WARNING: the format of this data will change before final release.
        Parameters:
        inputStream -
        Returns:
        instantiated Frame object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Note: this method blocks while data is read and the Frame is instantiated.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                 RenderedImage.Palette previewPalette)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves a frame to an output stream. A saved frame can be opened with loadFrame and then be rendered. Note: does not close the outputStream WARNING: this method does not create data compatible with the iOS SDK.
        Parameters:
        outputStream -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        for compatible method with iOS SDK.

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String path,
                 RenderedImage.Palette previewPalette)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves a thermal JPEG file, which has a rendered visual preview and embedded thermal data.
        Parameters:
        path - The full file path. Your app must have permission to write to the file path.
        previewPalette - The palette to use for the preview image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
